member.name: T:bbv.Common.Web.Caching.CacheManager
member.summary: Provides centralized access to the ASP.Net Cache.
member.remarks:
The class provides centralized access to the ASP.NET Cache object.
The default caching behaviour is to cache the data for the duration of the page request (see and ) It is possible to set the duration (TimeSpan) of caching in the configuration file (see example). The key in the configuration file has to match the main key under that the object is stored in the cache. To destinguish between different cached objects of the same main key, a subkey can be defined. That means the main key is used to define the duration of the caching and the combination of the main and subkey is used to identify the object in the cache. You can use ( to build a subkey. ///

member.name: F:bbv.Common.Web.Caching.CacheManager.PAGE_REQUEST
member.summary: Cache key for the ASP.NET cache entry that is the dependency root for cache entris that are stored only for the duration of the page request.

member.name: M:bbv.Common.Web.Caching.CacheManager.BuildSubCacheKey(System.Object[])
member.summary: Builds a subkey string from the list of subkey part values.
member.remarks: Use this method to build sub-cache-keys for caching data depending of search criterias.
member.param: Objects representing the parts of the subkey.

member.name: M:bbv.Common.Web.Caching.CacheManager.BuildSubCacheKeyPart(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a part to the SubCacheKey.
member.param: StringBuilder used to generate the sub cache key.

member.name: M:bbv.Common.Web.Caching.CacheManager.CacheItem(System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.Web.Caching.CacheItemRemovedCallback)
member.summary: Adds an object to the cache. The duration of caching is read from the configuration file.
member.param: First part of key to identify the object in the cache. If this key matches with a key in the configuration file then the data is cached for the duration specified in the configuration file.
Second part of the key to identify the object in the cache.
Method to be called when item is removed from the cache.
member.remarks: The key is used to match the object to be cached with a key in the configuration file. The element of the configuration file contains data about how the object is to be cached. For example how data about modules has to be handled. The subkey is used to build a unique identifier for the object in the cache. For example the id of the module.

member.name: M:bbv.Common.Web.Caching.CacheManager.CacheItem(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds an object to the cache. The duration of caching is read from the configuration file.
member.param: First part of key to identify the object in the cache. This key has to match with a key in the configuration file.
Second part of the key to identify the object in the cache.
member.remarks: The key is used to match the object to be cached with a key in the configuration file. The element of the configuration file contains data about how the object is to be cached. For example how data about modules has to be handled. The subkey is used to build a unique identifier for the object in the cache. For example the id of the module.

member.name: M:bbv.Common.Web.Caching.CacheManager.CacheItem(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds an object to the cache. The duration of caching is read from the configuration file.
member.param: Key to identify the object in the cache. This key has to match with a key in the configuration file.

member.name: M:bbv.Common.Web.Caching.CacheManager.CacheItem(System.String,System.Object,System.Web.Caching.CacheItemRemovedCallback)
member.summary: Adds an object to the cache. The duration of caching is read from the configuration file.
member.param: Key to identify the object in the cache. This key has to match with a key in the configuration file.
Method to be called when item is removed from the cache.

member.summary: Returns an object from the cache (if contained, otherwise null).

member.summary: Returns an object from the cache (if contained, otherwise null).

member.summary: Initializes the cache consistency checking.
member.remarks: A binary copy of all cached items is made and stored temporaly

member.name: M:bbv.Common.Web.Caching.CacheManager.UpdateConsistencyCheck(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Updates the stored data that is used for checking the consistency of the cache for the specified .
member.remarks: When an item is cached that was already present in the cache then this method gets called to update the data used to check the consistency of the cache. An update made through the Cache Manager is not a validation of the cache consistency.

member.name: M:bbv.Common.Web.Caching.CacheManager.CheckCacheConsistency
member.summary: Checks whether the Cache was modified during the request.

remarks.para: Checks whether the data stored in is equal to the data now present in the cache.
Note that new and deleted entries are allowed.

Exception
Error
Warning
Hint

member.name: T:bbv.Common.Web.Exceptions.ExceptionRepository
member.summary: The exception repository is used to store exceptions that has taken place during a process. At the end of that process the accumulated exceptions can be gathered at once and processed.
member.remarks: Normally the exception repository is only used for collecting minor exceptions such as hints and warnings, i.e not exceptions that are system critical.

member.name: T:bbv.Common.Web.ObjectFactory.IObjectFactory
member.summary: Provides access to "singleton" dependencies.
member.remarks: The is the central part of an application built with bbv.Common.Web. All dependencies that a class has (all classes it references) that should exist only once per scope (see below) should be accessed through the , which will create and store them in a configurable scope container (request, session, cache, application).

member.name: M:bbv.Common.Web.ObjectFactory.IObjectFactory.Get``1
member.summary: Returns the instance (dependency) for the requested type.

remarks.para: If a mapping for the requested type is defined in the configuration then an instance for the target type is searched instead of the requested type.
If no instance for the requested type (or mapping target type) is present a new instance is created. Therefore the created type has to have a parameterless constructor.
If the created instance implements then this ObjectFactory is set to the instance to maintain context.

member.name: M:bbv.Common.Web.ObjectFactory.IObjectFactory.Get``1(bbv.Common.Web.ObjectFactory.Scope)
member.summary: Returns the instance for the requested type.

remarks.para: If a mapping for the requested type is defined in the configuration then an instance for the target type is searched instead of the requested type.
If no instance for the requested type (or mapping target type) is present a new instance is created. Therefore the created type has to have a parameterless constructor.
If the created instance implements then this ObjectFactory is set to the instance to maintain context.

member.param: The context that is used to store/retrieve the instance.

member.name: M:bbv.Common.Web.ObjectFactory.IObjectFactory.Get``1(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the instance for the requested type.
member.param: if set to true [create if missing].

remarks.para: If a mapping for the requested type is defined in the configuration then an instance for the target type is searched instead of the requested type.
If no instance for the requested type (or mapping target type) is present a new instance is created. Therefore the created type has to have a parameterless constructor.
If the created instance implements then this ObjectFactory is set to the instance to maintain context.

member.name: M:bbv.Common.Web.ObjectFactory.IObjectFactory.Get``1(bbv.Common.Web.ObjectFactory.Scope,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the instance for the requested type.
member.param: The context that is used to store/retrieve the instance.
True if the dependency should be created if it does not exist yet.

remarks.para: If a mapping for the requested type is defined in the configuration then an instance for the target type is searched instead of the requested type.
If no instance for the requested type (or mapping target type) is present a new instance is created. Therefore the created type has to have a parameterless constructor.
If the created instance implements then this ObjectFactory is set to the instance to maintain context.

member.name: M:bbv.Common.Web.ObjectFactory.IObjectFactory.Set(System.Object,bbv.Common.Web.ObjectFactory.Scope)
member.summary: Sets a dependency instance to the object vault specified by .
member.remarks: Use this method to set dependencies that can not be created without context.
member.param: In which context this dependency is placed.

member.summary: Removes the dependency of type from all scopes.

member.name: P:bbv.Common.Web.ObjectFactory.ObjectFactory.Configuration
member.summary: Gets/sets the configuration for the ObjectFactory.

member.name: T:bbv.Common.Web.ObjectFactory.ObjectFactory.ObjectVault
member.summary: Dictionary that maps types to instances.

member.name: T:bbv.Common.Web.ObjectFactory.Scope
member.summary: The scope defines where an object is stored (Session, Cache, Application state or just for the duration of the request).

member.name: F:bbv.Common.Web.ObjectFactory.Scope.Page
member.summary: The object is stored within the page and will only be available during the current request.

member.name: F:bbv.Common.Web.ObjectFactory.Scope.Cache
member.summary: The object is stored in the Cache. It will remain there until it is removed by the asp.net cache manager.

member.name: F:bbv.Common.Web.ObjectFactory.Scope.Session
member.summary: The object is stored in the Session and will remain there as long as the Session is running.

member.name: F:bbv.Common.Web.ObjectFactory.Scope.Application
member.summary: The object is stored in the Application state and will remain there until the application is stopped.

member.name: F:bbv.Common.Web.ObjectFactory.Scope.Undefined
member.summary: Used internally

member.summary: Returns the text of a TextBox in a specific type.

member.name: M:bbv.Common.Web.UI.TextControlHelper.Unbind``1(System.Web.UI.ITextControl,System.Boolean@,System.Exception)
member.summary: Returns the text of a TextBox in a specific type.
member.typeparam: The type the text in the TextBox is converted to.
member.param: Whether the conversion was successful. Will remain false if false was passed to the method.
The exception that is added to the ExceptionRepository if the conversion fails. Can be null.

member.name: M:bbv.Common.Web.UI.TextControlHelper.Unbind``1(System.Web.UI.ITextControl,System.Data.DataRow,System.Data.DataColumn,System.Boolean@,System.Exception)
member.summary: Stores the value from a TextBox to a column in a DataRow. If the text is empty then DBNull is stored. !! Do not use for string values when empty values should result in an empty string !!
member.typeparam: The type the text in the TextBox is converted to.
member.param: The DataRow the value is written to.
The DataColumn the value is written to.
Whether the conversion was successful. Will remain false if false was passed to the method.
The exception that is added to the ExceptionRepository if the conversion fails. Can be null.
